translation:
Dear Bernardina Piratini, August 22, 1838.

Yesterday, almost at night, I received yours and the gift you sent me with it, for which our students jumped with joy, as did I upon knowing that you and our children were well, whom you will embrace for me, telling Bruto that I do not send him raisins because there are none. Yesterday I wrote to you by Roberto and I confirm what I told you, for I cannot with the work and with missing you.

Damasceno promised to send the flour and wheat; that item here is at 8$ the alqueire, but I expect some from Rio Pardo and will send it to you immediately upon its arrival.

Suddenly, you will have me there hugging you tightly, and farewell. Yours, Almeida.

Senhora Bom Retiro.
